segments.text: Hey , Tom , what to go for a run ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No thanks . I like to run in the morning . I ran a couple of miles when I woke up today .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I try to do that , but I can ’ t get up early enough .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I couldn ’ t either at first , but you get used to it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It ’ s so hot at lunchtime ; I ’ d rather run in the morning .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , why don ’ t you come tomorrow ? I ’ ll stop by your house on my way out .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I could try , but I can ’ t say for sure if I ’ ll get up in time . What time do you want to go ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ ll give you a call around 6:00 and stop by around 6:30 .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: O . K . , maybe if I have someone to go with , I ’ ll be able to get up in time for a jog .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Great , I ’ ll see you then .
segments.speaker: S2
